N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 459.3 - Administrative requirements

State Regulations
A senior citizen center shall meet the following
administrative requirements in order to be an operator or provider of social
group services for senior citizens: (a) all buildings, premises and equipment
shall be safe and suitable for the comfort and use of the senior citizen, shall
be maintained in a good state of repair and sanitation, and shall conform to
all applicable laws, ordinances and to the rules and regulations of all local
authorities relating to the premises such as safety, fire, health, sanitation
and occupancy; (b) paid staff, as
required by the needs of the center's program and services, shall be adequate
in both number and competency; (c) due consideration shall be given to the employment of senior citizens by senior
citizen centers; (d) no person
shall be denied services or participation in a center program because of race, creed, sex or national origin; (e) a system to receive voluntary contributions shall be in effect. Such
contributions are to be received in a confidential manner and without
coercion; (f) except in exceptional
circumstances approved by the department, the center shall operate at least
five days a week, six hours per day; (g) maintain and provide the department with
program and statistical information as may be required; (h) funds shall be accounted for and handled
according to good fiscal practice; (i) a district may withhold reimbursement
from a sponsor who has contracted with such district to provide senior center
services if such center is not in substantial compliance with the
administrative requirements specified in subdivision (a) of this section. The
department may withhold reimbursement from a district for directly operated
senior citizen centers not in substantial compliance with the administrative
requirements specified in subdivision (a) of this section. Notes
